oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An old sorceress (a relative who befriended the narrator’s family), her power of turning herself into a lioness, her pet springbok, etc. By Dia!kwãin (L V.-10. 4707-4743). Dia!kwain's aunt, the sorceress Ttanno !khauken, changes herself into a lioness to see what her people are doing and to take care of them. Dia!kwain's father kills her short-horned springbok, but she is not angry even though it is not a food springbok, but a tame one (it was her 'heart's springbok'). 1) pp.4707 opp-p.4710v, p.4712v-p.4714v: see A great Bushman doctress and sorceress Ttanno !khauken who did not understand Dutch, 2) pp.4716v-4718v: see About Dia!kwain's relations, 3) p.4739v: Dia!kwain's mother will 'see more' (springbok) after putting on Ttanno !khauken's old cap, 4) p.4741v: Dia!kwain's mother is said to have no 'flocks', but the narrator means cattle rather than sheep, 5) This story is found in Book V-10.
